2.description: Busy Supply Chamber - INPUT/OUTPUT with JUMP loop

3.description: Replica Slate - COPYFROM from construction slots (5, 2, 0)
3.note: COPYFROM uses slot indices: 0=first slot (value 5), 1=second slot (value 2), 2=third slot (value 0)

4.description: Scrambler Handler - Swap pairs of inputs
4.note: Stores first input in slot 0, outputs second input, then outputs stored first input

5.description: Replica Slate - Add pairs of inputs
5.note: Stores first input in slot 0, adds it to second input, outputs result

6.description: Tripler Room - Triple each input (multiply by 3)
6.note: Stores input in slot 0, adds it twice (x + x + x = 3x), outputs

7.description: Octoplier Suite - Multiply by 8 using only 3 ADD commands
7.note: Uses 3 slots: x -> 2x -> 4x -> 8x (each ADD doubles the value)

8.description: Zero Exterminator - Output only non-zero values
8.note: JUMP = 0 skips OUTPUT if value is zero, otherwise outputs and loops

9.note: JUMP = 0 jumps to OUTPUT only if value is zero, otherwise skips OUTPUT

10.note: Stores first in slot 0, second in slot 1. Outputs (second - first), then (first - second)

11.description: Equalization Room - Output one value only if two inputs are equal
11.note: Stores first in slot 0, subtracts from second. If result is 0 (equal), output stored value

12.description: Note: Level 12 appears to be a duplicate of Level 8 (Zero Exterminator)
12.note: Same as level 8 - Output only non-zero values

notes.JUMP_commands: JUMP commands require a label reference. In the solution format, use { "command": "" } as a placeholder for the label. The system will resolve these when loading.
notes.slot_indices: COPYFROM, COPYTO, ADD, SUB commands use slot indices (0, 1, 2, etc.) corresponding to constructionSlots array order.
notes.firebase_format: Store solutions as JSON array of CommandWithArgType objects in Firebase. The simpleFormat is provided for reference only.
